ACT
29
The form of the will as a presumption of validity
A will is valid if it is made in the form established by law and with the assumptions provided for by law.
In regular circumstances, anyone can make a will in any of the forms provided by law.
Due to a deficiency in the form, the annulment of the will may be requested after the opening of the inheritance only by a person who has a legal interest in it, and within one year from the time he learned about the will, and no later than 10 years from the promulgation of the will. The period of one year cannot begin to run before the promulgation of the will.
